summary: Adds five stand alone armor sets that are \"invisible.\"
descriptionHtml:
[b]Background of this Mod:[/b]
The idea for this mod came when I was looking at the body mod (Caliente\'s CBBE Nevernude Slim) I was using and thought it would be funny to be able to play the game naked but still retain armor rating. Another reason is that there currently are not many armor mods for the CBBE Slim and I lack the skills, though I have been trying to learn, to create such mods. I like this body mod the most, but it seems pointless to use it when there isn\'t much out there that actually uses it.

[b]About this mod:[/b]
This mod can add up to a total of four stand alone armor for both male and female character.

Low End Light Armor Set (LL): This set is based on the Hide armor set. It can be crafted at a forge using the same recipe as the Hide armor and it can be upgraded at a workbench with one leather per piece. It can be enchanted.

Low End Heavy Armor Set (HL): This set is based on the Iron armor set. It can be crafted at a forge using the same recipe as the Iron armor and it can be upgraded at a workbench with one iron ingot per piece. It can be enchanted.

High End Light Armor (LH): This set is based on the Dragonscale armor set. It requires the Dragon Armor smithing perk to be crafted at a forge using the same recipe as the Dragonscale armor and it can be upgraded at a workbench using one dragon scale per piece. It can be enchanted.

High End Heavy Armor(HH): This set is based on the Dragonscale and Daedric armor sets. It requires the Dragon Armor smithing perk to be crafted at a forge using the same recipe as the Dragoplate armor and it can be upgraded at a workbench using one dragon bone per piece. The armor ratings for each piece has been increased to be equal to the armor rating of the Daedric armor pieces. it can be enchanted.

Mage Set: As per request, an invisible set of clothes for mages has been added. It is based on a the Psiijic set. It can be crafted at a forge under MISC and requires one leather per piece. It can be enchanted.

There are four options to download. The first is the main file that contains all four armors. If you wish to only use the high end, only the low end sets, or only the mage set, there are optional downloads that contain only each one. If you use these, you do not need to download the main file.

This mod DOES NOT include any body mods with it. It does, however, require a body mod already installed to work properly. In theory, any body mod should work, though it has only been tested with CBBE Nevernude Slim. It will NOT work properly with the vanilla body. I hope to fix this if it is within my abilities.

[b]Changelog[/b]
2/27/12 - Updated to work with a conflicting mod.
2/12/12 - Mage set added.
2/2/12 - Low end versions added.
2/1/12 - Initial release

[b]Obtaining the Items:[/b]
All pieces can be crafted at a forge with the proper smithing perk. If you do not wish to they can also be added via the console. 

To add via the console, use the command player.additem \"itemcode\" 1 without the quotes. The item codes are the same for all versions of this mod. These are the item codes for each item:

[u]Light Armor[/u] 
High End                                         
Armor - xx001000                              
Boots - xx001002                             
Gauntlets - xx001003                        
Helmet - xx001004                           

Low End
Armor - xx00100D
Boots - xx001009
Gauntlets - xx001010
Helmet - xx00100F

[u]Heavy Armor[/u] 
High End
Boots - xx001008
Armor - xx00100A
Gauntlets - xx00100B
Helmet - xx00100C

Low End 
Boots - xx001011
Armor - xx001022
Gauntlets - xx00100E
Helmet - xx001024

[u]Mage Armor[/u]
Boots - xx001023
Gloves - xx001035
Hood - xx001036
Robes - xx001037

The xx stands for the load order of the mod. If you do not know how to find this, you can also find it via the console using the help command.

For example, if you typed:

help \"Invisible Helmet\" 4

You would get a list of the item codes for all items with Invisible Helmet in their name. In this case, you would see any of the helmets installed from this mod with the correct load number. This number will be the same for all armor pieces in this mod.

To add the high end heavy armor helmet, you would type the following into the console:
player.additem xx00100C

[b]Install:[/b]
1. Make sure you have a body mod already installed!
2. Place the included .esp file into your data folder. (steam/steamapps/common/skyrim/data)

[b]Uninstall:[/b]
1. Remove the .esp file from your data folder. (steam/steamapps/common/skyrim/data)

[b]Known Bugs:[/b]
-Does not work with vanilla body.

Please let me know if you find any other bugs!

[b]Mods used in the screenshots:[/b]
NOTE: None of these mods are included in this mod. I personally believe the authors deserve recognition since their mods were used in the screenshots. If you like any of the mods, please go download them from their original authors!

[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=2666]Calientes CBBE Nevernude Slim v3[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=7485]Nidias Face for CBBE[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=7127]RANs HeadMesh Variants[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=3863]SkyUI[/url]

-I am currently searching for the mod for the hair used. I can\'t locate it in the folder with all the mods I\'ve download and I can\'t find it again on nexus. If anyone recognizes it, it would be much apperciated if they could point me in the right direction.

[b]Thanks to:[/b]
-Bethesda for making such a wonderful game and allowing us users to create mods to our liking.
-The Nexus community for all the great mods that already exist and for inspiring me to try my hand at modding.
-The tutorial I read months ago that went through how to add new armors. I don\'t seem to be able to find this on Nexus again.
author: Adinsx08
